views.markdown:
- Fixes for iOS 13 support - Fixed an issue preventing most app binaries from being dumped.
- Added cycript module:
@import net.limneos.classdumpdyld
- Fixed a parsing issue where templates or function definitions inside structs or unions could not be parsed.

- Added dumpBundleForClass function to use from within cycript. classdump-dyld can now find and dump any library/image loaded in the process.
- Fixed dumpClass (in-cycript function) to correctly find and dump classes in images other than the main bundle's.
- Fixed dumpBundle (in-cycript function) to correctly work after dumpClass was issued before it.

- Major update: Added cycript integration.
You can now dlopen /usr/lib/libclassdumpdyld.dylib in cycript after injecting any application,
and dlsym the dumpClass and dumpBundle functions.

More info at Github

- Fixed an MH_MAGIC_64 identification issue.

- Added option to dump only one defined class from within an image.
- Fixed some iOS9 classes causing crashes.
- Github code has been updated
- Fixed an issue that might cause a hang when dumping iOS9 ModelIO framework. - Changed the default option to not create original directory structure of the dumped image path. Use -b to create.
- Added a few classes that fail to initialize outside of their original environment in the exception list.

- Fixed a directory write issue when injecting sandboxed executables

- All executables are now injected using libclassdumpdyld.dylib unless specified differently with -e option.
- Now you can dump all executables, including daemons and other tools.
- Improved library's memory handling. Now you can dump huge executables/applications.
- Switched from returning bool to BOOL for types "B".
- Fixed some type errors in protocols
- Added -a options to include Applications directory in recursive dumps

- Fixed a crash when dumping SpringBoard on iOS <7.x

- Updated with iOS 8 support
- Added libclassdumpdyld.dylib for injecting 64bit executables
- Now classdump-dyld dumps 64bit executables
- Fixed error where properties had different types than methods
- Fixed some type encoding mistakes
- Added -D option for debugging/troubleshooting
- Fixed some crashes when dumping particular classes
